channel.description: Recent content in Functions on Luxformel Bibliothéik

item.title: Exponential, Logarithmic and Hyperbolic Functions
item.description:
Exponential, Logarithmic and Hyperbolic Functions

Exercise 1 : Basic Exponent Rules

Calculate the terms given in the next questions or give a transformation:

  1. $a^{-n}$
  2. $27^{\frac{1}{3}}$
  3. $a^{\frac{1}{n}}$
  4. $(0,1)^0$
  5. $(y^3)^2$
  6. $x^{-\frac{3}{2}}$
  7. $10^3 \cdot 10^{-3} \cdot 10^2$
  8. $3^{-3}$

Exercise 2 : Roots and Powers

Calculate the terms given in the next questions or give a transformation:

  1. $(\sqrt{2})^2$
  2. $e^{\frac{1}{10}}$
  3. $(\ln 2)^0$
  4. $\sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{7}$
  5. $(0,5)^2 \cdot (0,5)^{-4} \cdot (0,5)^0$
  6. $\sqrt{8} \cdot \sqrt{3}$

Exercise 3 : Common Logarithms (base 10)

Calculate the terms given in the next questions or give a transformation:

item.title: Dirac Delta Function
item.description:
Dirac Delta Function

Exercise 1 : Basic Delta Integrals

Evaluate the following integrals:

  1. $\displaystyle \int_{2}^{6} (3x^2 - 2x - 1) , \delta(x - 3) , dx$
  2. $\displaystyle \int_{0}^{5} \cos x ; \delta(x - \pi) , dx$
  3. $\displaystyle \int_{-1}^{3} x^3 , \delta(x + 1) , dx$
  4. $\displaystyle \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \ln(x + 3) , \delta(x + 2) , dx$
  5. $\displaystyle \int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-x} , \delta(x - 2) , dx$

Exercise 2 : Delta with Scaled & Shifted Arguments

Use $\delta(ax) = \frac{1}{|a|}\delta(x)$ and similar properties to evaluate:

item.title: Inverse Functions
item.description:
Inverse Functions

Exercise 1

Find $ f^{-1} $ for each function $ f $

  1. $ f(x) = x^3 + 1 $
  2. $ f(x) = (x - 1)^3 $
  3. $ f(x) = \begin{cases} x & \text{rational} \ -x & \text{irrational} \end{cases} $
  4. $ f(x) = \begin{cases} -x^2 & x \geq 0 \ 1 - x^3 & x < 0 \end{cases} $
  5. $ f(x) = \begin{cases} x & x \neq a_i \ a_{i+1} & x = a_i \ (i < n) \ a_1 & x = a_n \end{cases} $
  6. $ f(x) = x + \lfloor x \rfloor $
  7. $ f(0.a_1a_2a_3\ldots) = 0.a_2a_1a_3\ldots $
  8. $ f(x) = \frac{x}{1 - x^2}, \ -1 < x < 1 $

Exercise 2

Describe $ f^{-1} $’s graph when $ f $ is:

item.title: Functions
item.description:
Functions

Exercise 1

Let $f(x) = \frac{1}{1 + x}$. Find:

  1. $f(f(x))$ and determine its domain

  2. $f\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)$

  3. $f(cx)$

  4. $f(x + y)$

  5. $f(x) + f(y)$

  6. For which numbers $c$ does there exist $x$ such that $f(cx) = f(x)$?

  7. For which numbers $c$ does $f(cx) = f(x)$ hold for two different values of $x$?

Exercise 2

Let $g(x) = x^2$ and $h(x) = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{if } x \text{ rational} \ 1 & \text{if } x \text{ irrational} \end{cases}$. Find:
